spell.name: Death Powers: Death Grip (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
You may use your bonus action and spend 1 Soul Point to conjure a hand of necrotic energy that reaches for a creature within 30 feet of you. This creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled to the nearest empty space close to you, provided that the path is clear.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Death Protection (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
When a creature's attack hits you or an ally within 5 feet of you, you may take a reaction and spend 1 Soul Point to give an AC bonus to the target hit by the attack equal to your proficiency bonus against this attack.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Death Strike (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you may spend 1 Soul Point to cause an extra 1d10 of necrotic damage to the creature. At 11th level, you may spend 2 Soul Points to cause an extra 2d10 of necrotic damage. You may only use this ability once per turn. If a creature dies in the same turn you hit it with a Death Strike, you gain 1d6 temporary hit points, but you can't gain any Soul Point from that death.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Death Terror (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
You may use your bonus action and spend 1 Soul Point to attempt to frighten a creature that is adjacent to you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the affected creature may make a saving throw to try to end the frightened condition.
Frightened: • A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight. • The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Fleeing Death (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
When another creature deals damage to you with a melee attack, you may take a reaction and spend 1 Soul Point to reduce the damage by 1d10. At 7th level, you may spend additional Soul Points to further reduce the damage taken. For each extra Soul Point spent with this Death Power, you reduce an additional 1d10 of the damage taken.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Undying Knight (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
As an action and by spending 1 Soul Point, you can spend up to 3 Hit Dice to regain hit points. Additionally, you regain an extra amount of hit points equal to half your Constitution bonus (rounded up) for each Hit Die used.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Unwearying Warrior (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
When you would suffer a level of exhaustion, you can spend 1 Soul Point and not suffer it, regardless of its origin.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Visions of the Afterlife (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd Level
You can use a bonus action and spend 1 Soul Point to gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet until your next short or long rest. If you already have darkvision, this Death Power doubles its range. When activated, you can concentrate using a bonus action to gain a glimpse of what is occurring in the Ethereal Plane for the next 10 minutes. After this time, Vision of the Afterlife ends.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Ethereal Move (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 7th Level
You may use your bonus action and spend 1 Soul Point to automatically move 30 feet without spending your speed. During this movement, you move through the ethereal plane, so you do not provoke opportunity attacks, ignore difficult terrain, and can move through objects and creatures. You must end your movement in an unoccupied space, or be expelled to the nearest unoccupied space.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Strangling Grip (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 7th Level, Death Grip
When you declare the use of the Death Grip, you can use an action and spend an extra 1 Soul Point to impose the restrained condition on the target, in addition to the effects of Death Grip, if the target fails its saving throw. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the condition.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Death Embrace (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 7th Level
When you suffer cold, lightning, or necrotic damage, you may take a reaction and spend 1 Soul Point to gain resistance against the triggering damage. At 12th level, you may spend an extra 1 Soul Point to gain immunity against the triggering damage, rather than just resistance
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Undead Fortitude (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 7th Level
When your hit points are reduced to 0 but you are not killed outright, you can spend 1 Soul Point and make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a success, you remain at 1 hit point. The DC increases by 2 for each subsequent use of this ability before a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Creeping Darkness (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th Level, Ethereal Move
When an ally within 60 feet of you suffers an attack, you may take a reaction and spend 1 Soul Point to teleport to an unoccupied space adjacent to them and take the attack in their place, gaining resistance to the damage from this attack
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Grave Mist (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th Level
You may use your bonus action and spend 1 Soul Point to summon an eerie mist. You affect a circular area with a 10-foot radius centered on you for 1 minute. Any creature that enters or is within this area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is poisoned for the next minute. If the creature is no longer in the affected area, it may make another saving throw at the end of each of its turns to try to end the poisoned condition.
Poisoned: • A poisoned creature has disadvantage on Attack rolls and Ability Checks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Life Drain (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th Level
You can use your action to attempt to touch a living creature adjacent to you. To determine if your touch is successful, you must make an unarmed strike against the creature. On a hit, you deal 1d10 necrotic damage for each Soul Point spent on this Death Power, and regain hit points equal to the damage dealt.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Death Powers: Terrifying Howl (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th Level
You can use your action and spend 1 Soul Point to unleash a haunting howl that mimics the sound of death. Creatures of your choice that can hear you and are within 60 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is frightened of you for the next minute. A frightened creature must use all its movement to move away from you. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 229 (Homebrew)
